etymology.description: 中国 + 美术馆 = China’s national art museum.
etymology.interpretation: Proper-noun compound naming the national-level fine arts museum of China, located in Beijing. Combines the country name with the institution type to signal scope and focus on fine arts.
etymology.simplification: 國→国, 術→术, 館→馆 were simplified in mainland reforms to reduce strokes and standardize components (囗, 朮→术, 食→饣) for faster writing; 中 and 美 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们打算参观中国美术馆(我們打算參觀中國美術館)。
examples.english: We plan to visit the National Art Museum of China.

examples.chinese: 中国美术馆位于北京东城区(中國美術館位於北京東城區)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó Měishùguǎn wèiyú Běijīng Dōngchéng Qū.
examples.english: The National Art Museum of China is located in Beijing’s Dongcheng District.

examples.chinese: 这个展览在中国美术馆举行(這個展覽在中國美術館舉行)，吸引了很多观众(吸引了很多觀眾)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zhǎnlǎn zài Zhōngguó Měishùguǎn jǔxíng, xīyǐnle hěn duō guānzhòng.
examples.english: This exhibition is being held at the National Art Museum of China and has attracted many visitors.
